explanation: Agent A is correct. The initial guard if (MHD_digest_get_hash_size(algo3) != userhash_size) return NULL; guarantees that for any control flow reaching the switch the value userhash_size equals the digest size for that algo3. The sizeof(user_ids[0].userhash_sha512_256) is a compile-time constant that (in this codebase) matches the digest size for the SHA512_256 algorithm, so the subsequent test if (sizeof(...) != userhash_size) is provably always false along that path. That makes the controlling expression invariant, which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 (no applicable exceptions apply). If MHD_digest_get_hash_size could vary or has side effects, the situation would be different, but given the intended mapping between algo3 and the sizeof constants the report is valid. Suggested remedies: remove the redundant check or restructure the logic so the condition is not invariant (or replace it with an appropriate assertion or compile-time check).
